summary: Facing declining budgets and aging information technology, in 2014 IRS officials began envisioning new approaches for interacting with taxpayers that they called the "Future State." They described the Future State as guiding principles—rather than a specific plan—to transform IRS. This vision included giving taxpayers more web-based options for communicating with IRS and dealing with taxes. For example, a taxpayer might receive personalized messages and address...
title: Tax Administration: Status of IRS Future State Vision
